newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada help wanted index rises 2.0 pct in April.
newsitem.headline: Canada help wanted index rises 2.0 pct in April.

text.p: Canada's help wanted index, seasonally adjusted, rose 2.0 percent in April to 102 (1991=100) from 100 in March, Statistics Canada said on Thursday.

The help wanted index monitors changes in help wanted advertisements in 20 cities. It reflects the intent of employers in these labor markets to hire new workers. Increases in the index are usually followed by drops in the unemployment rate.
A Reuters survey of economists had on average forecast a rise in the index to 101.5 points.
(For more information on this release from Statistics Canada's Labour Division, contact Michael Scrim at 613-951-4090.)
